title: Reading, querying and writing GWAS summary data in VCF format
text: VCF querying functions faster optionally use bcftools, available R package use strategy. set location bcftools package, use Note bcftools binary Windows available, querying options slower Windows. LD related functions package uses plink 1.90. can specify location plink installation running Alternatively can automatically use use binaries bundled : https://github.com/mrcieu/genetics.binaRies unset path: vignette use bundled binaries genetics.binaRies.
code: library(gwasvcf) set_bcftools('/path/to/bcftools') set_plink('/path/to/plink') remotes::install_github('mrcieu/genetics.binaRies') set_plink() set_bcftools() set_plink(NULL) set_bcftools(NULL) suppressWarnings(suppressPackageStartupMessages({   library(gwasvcf)   library(VariantAnnotation)   library(dplyr)   library(magrittr) })) set_bcftools() #> Path not provided, using binaries in the MRCIEU/genetics.binaRies package

title: Reading, querying and writing GWAS summary data in VCF format
text: read entire dataset use readVcf function. example ’ll use bundled data small subset Speliotes et al 2010 BMI GWAS. Please refer VariantAnnotation package documentation full details CollapsedVCF object. brief summary follows. General info dataset can obtained calling : 92 rows 1 column means 92 SNPs one GWAS. See header information: See names GWAS datasets (case just one, refers IEU GWAS database ID name): case can obtain information study ieugwasr package e.g. ieugwasr::gwasinfo("IEU--2"). components within object: header meta data describing dataset, including association result variables rowRanges information variant info metadata variant geno actual association results GWAS rowRanges object GenomicRanges class, useful performing fast operations chromosome position information.
code: vcffile <- system.file("extdata", "data.vcf.gz", package="gwasvcf") vcf <- readVcf(vcffile) class(vcf) #> [1] "CollapsedVCF" #> attr(,"package") #> [1] "VariantAnnotation" vcf #> class: CollapsedVCF  #> dim: 92 1  #> rowRanges(vcf): #>   GRanges with 5 metadata columns: paramRangeID, REF, ALT, QUAL, FILTER #> info(vcf): #>   DataFrame with 1 column: AF #> info(header(vcf)): #>       Number Type  Description      #>    AF A      Float Allele Frequency #> geno(vcf): #>   List of length 9: ES, SE, LP, AF, SS, EZ, SI, NC, ID #> geno(header(vcf)): #>       Number Type   Description                                                      #>    ES A      Float  Effect size estimate relative to the alternative allele          #>    SE A      Float  Standard error of effect size estimate                           #>    LP A      Float  -log10 p-value for effect estimate                               #>    AF A      Float  Alternate allele frequency in the association study              #>    SS A      Float  Sample size used to estimate genetic effect                      #>    EZ A      Float  Z-score provided if it was used to derive the EFFECT and SE f... #>    SI A      Float  Accuracy score of summary data imputation                        #>    NC A      Float  Number of cases used to estimate genetic effect                  #>    ID 1      String Study variant identifier header(vcf) #> class: VCFHeader  #> samples(1): IEU-a-2 #> meta(4): fileformat META SAMPLE contig #> fixed(1): FILTER #> info(1): AF #> geno(9): ES SE ... NC ID samples(header(vcf)) #> [1] "IEU-a-2" rowRanges(vcf) #> GRanges object with 92 ranges and 5 metadata columns: #>              seqnames    ranges strand | paramRangeID            REF #>                 <Rle> <IRanges>  <Rle> |     <factor> <DNAStringSet> #>   rs12565286        1    721290      * |           NA              G #>   rs11804171        1    723819      * |           NA              T #>    rs2977670        1    723891      * |           NA              G #>    rs3094315        1    752566      * |           NA              G #>    rs2073813        1    753541      * |           NA              G #>          ...      ...       ...    ... .          ...            ... #>     rs715643        1   1172907      * |           NA              C #>    rs6675798        1   1176597      * |           NA              T #>    rs6603783        1   1181751      * |           NA              T #>    rs6603785        1   1186502      * |           NA              A #>    rs6603787        1   1188225      * |           NA              G #>                             ALT      QUAL      FILTER #>              <DNAStringSetList> <numeric> <character> #>   rs12565286                  C        NA        PASS #>   rs11804171                  A        NA        PASS #>    rs2977670                  C        NA        PASS #>    rs3094315                  A        NA        PASS #>    rs2073813                  A        NA        PASS #>          ...                ...       ...         ... #>     rs715643                  T        NA        PASS #>    rs6675798                  C        NA        PASS #>    rs6603783                  C        NA        PASS #>    rs6603785                  T        NA        PASS #>    rs6603787                  T        NA        PASS #>   ------- #>   seqinfo: 84 sequences from GRCh37 genome

title: Reading, querying and writing GWAS summary data in VCF format
text: VCF object somewhat complex can read VariantAnnotation package documentation. can create various formats might easier use . example, create GRanges object great fast chromosome-position operations Create data frame: direct conversion formats tools TwoSampleMR, coloc, many others can also made using https://github.com/mrcieu/gwasglue R package.

title: Reading, querying and writing GWAS summary data in VCF format
text: query_gwas() function takes either filename vcf file, vcf object main argument. can query rsid, pval chrompos. example identical, former saves time memory querying file using index reading required. Examples filters : ’s possible chain filters together e.g. ’s possible multiple GWAS studies per vcf. can specify specific GWAS studies read using e.g. Note querying chrompos fastest way deal VCFs, use rsid possible speed issue.
code: vcfsubset <- query_gwas(vcffile, chrompos=c("1:1097291-1099437")) vcf <- readVcf(vcffile) vcfsubset <- query_gwas(vcf, chrompos=c("1:1097291-1099437")) vcf <- query_gwas(vcffile, rsid=c("rs3128126", "rs3121561", "rs3813193")) vcf #> class: CollapsedVCF  #> dim: 3 1  #> rowRanges(vcf): #>   GRanges with 5 metadata columns: paramRangeID, REF, ALT, QUAL, FILTER #> info(vcf): #>   DataFrame with 3 columns: AF, AC, AN #> info(header(vcf)): #>       Number Type    Description                                 #>    AF A      Float   Allele Frequency                            #>    AC A      Integer Allele count in genotypes                   #>    AN 1      Integer Total number of alleles in called genotypes #> geno(vcf): #>   List of length 9: ES, SE, LP, AF, SS, EZ, SI, NC, ID #> geno(header(vcf)): #>       Number Type   Description                                                      #>    ES A      Float  Effect size estimate relative to the alternative allele          #>    SE A      Float  Standard error of effect size estimate                           #>    LP A      Float  -log10 p-value for effect estimate                               #>    AF A      Float  Alternate allele frequency in the association study              #>    SS A      Float  Sample size used to estimate genetic effect                      #>    EZ A      Float  Z-score provided if it was used to derive the EFFECT and SE f... #>    SI A      Float  Accuracy score of summary data imputation                        #>    NC A      Float  Number of cases used to estimate genetic effect                  #>    ID 1      String Study variant identifier vcf <- query_gwas(vcffile, pval=0.5) vcf #> class: CollapsedVCF  #> dim: 45 1  #> rowRanges(vcf): #>   GRanges with 5 metadata columns: paramRangeID, REF, ALT, QUAL, FILTER #> info(vcf): #>   DataFrame with 3 columns: AF, AC, AN #> info(header(vcf)): #>       Number Type    Description                                 #>    AF A      Float   Allele Frequency                            #>    AC A      Integer Allele count in genotypes                   #>    AN 1      Integer Total number of alleles in called genotypes #> geno(vcf): #>   List of length 9: ES, SE, LP, AF, SS, EZ, SI, NC, ID #> geno(header(vcf)): #>       Number Type   Description                                                      #>    ES A      Float  Effect size estimate relative to the alternative allele          #>    SE A      Float  Standard error of effect size estimate                           #>    LP A      Float  -log10 p-value for effect estimate                               #>    AF A      Float  Alternate allele frequency in the association study              #>    SS A      Float  Sample size used to estimate genetic effect                      #>    EZ A      Float  Z-score provided if it was used to derive the EFFECT and SE f... #>    SI A      Float  Accuracy score of summary data imputation                        #>    NC A      Float  Number of cases used to estimate genetic effect                  #>    ID 1      String Study variant identifier vcf <- query_gwas(vcffile, chrompos=c("1:1097291-1099437")) vcf #> class: CollapsedVCF  #> dim: 2 1  #> rowRanges(vcf): #>   GRanges with 5 metadata columns: paramRangeID, REF, ALT, QUAL, FILTER #> info(vcf): #>   DataFrame with 3 columns: AF, AC, AN #> info(header(vcf)): #>       Number Type    Description                                 #>    AF A      Float   Allele Frequency                            #>    AC A      Integer Allele count in genotypes                   #>    AN 1      Integer Total number of alleles in called genotypes #> geno(vcf): #>   List of length 9: ES, SE, LP, AF, SS, EZ, SI, NC, ID #> geno(header(vcf)): #>       Number Type   Description                                                      #>    ES A      Float  Effect size estimate relative to the alternative allele          #>    SE A      Float  Standard error of effect size estimate                           #>    LP A      Float  -log10 p-value for effect estimate                               #>    AF A      Float  Alternate allele frequency in the association study              #>    SS A      Float  Sample size used to estimate genetic effect                      #>    EZ A      Float  Z-score provided if it was used to derive the EFFECT and SE f... #>    SI A      Float  Accuracy score of summary data imputation                        #>    NC A      Float  Number of cases used to estimate genetic effect                  #>    ID 1      String Study variant identifier vcf <- query_gwas(vcffile, rsid=c("rs3128126", "rs3121561", "rs3813193")) %>%     query_gwas(pval=0.5) vcf #> class: CollapsedVCF  #> dim: 1 1  #> rowRanges(vcf): #>   GRanges with 5 metadata columns: paramRangeID, REF, ALT, QUAL, FILTER #> info(vcf): #>   DataFrame with 3 columns: AF, AC, AN #> info(header(vcf)): #>       Number Type    Description                                 #>    AF A      Float   Allele Frequency                            #>    AC A      Integer Allele count in genotypes                   #>    AN 1      Integer Total number of alleles in called genotypes #> geno(vcf): #>   List of length 9: ES, SE, LP, AF, SS, EZ, SI, NC, ID #> geno(header(vcf)): #>       Number Type   Description                                                      #>    ES A      Float  Effect size estimate relative to the alternative allele          #>    SE A      Float  Standard error of effect size estimate                           #>    LP A      Float  -log10 p-value for effect estimate                               #>    AF A      Float  Alternate allele frequency in the association study              #>    SS A      Float  Sample size used to estimate genetic effect                      #>    EZ A      Float  Z-score provided if it was used to derive the EFFECT and SE f... #>    SI A      Float  Accuracy score of summary data imputation                        #>    NC A      Float  Number of cases used to estimate genetic effect                  #>    ID 1      String Study variant identifier vcf <- query_gwas(vcffile, rsid=c("rs3128126", "rs3121561", "rs3813193"), id="IEU-a-2")

title: Reading, querying and writing GWAS summary data in VCF format
text: Querying rsid slow. large number queries rsid performed worth generating index speed querying. approach uses SQLite create local database, linking rsid chromosome position. strips ‘rs’ rs identifiers make fast searchers integer. concept based developed : bioforensics/rsidx. create index: query using index:
code: create_rsidx_index_from_vcf(vcffile, "index.rsidx") #> Extracting position info #> Generating index vcf <- query_gwas(vcffile, rsid=c("rs3128126", "rs3121561", "rs3813193"), rsidx="index.rsidx")

title: Reading, querying and writing GWAS summary data in VCF format
text: Querying p-value slow. worth generating index file p-values speed . Similar rsid queries, uses sqlite database linking -log10 pvalues chromosome position. create index: query using index:
code: create_pval_index_from_vcf(vcffile, maximum_pval=0.05, "index.pvali") #> Extracting pval info #> [1] "CREATE TABLE pval_to_coord (chrom TEXT NOT NULL DEFAULT NULL, coord INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT NULL, LP REAL NOT NULL DEFAULT 0);" #> [2] ".separator ,"                                                                                                                    #> [3] ".import /var/folders/9j/bw4vdrw94yndry3z9cv8ms1m0000gn/T//RtmpFnAKs1/file22f4fdc3a4d pval_to_coord"                              #> [4] "CREATE INDEX idx_LP ON pval_to_coord (LP)" #> Generating index vcf <- query_gwas(vcffile, pval=0.05, pvali="index.pvali") #> Using pval index #> Identified 7 variants passing threshold. Extracting...

title: Reading, querying and writing GWAS summary data in VCF format
text: fastest way query VCFs specifying chromosome position. Can specify specific positions, ranges. e.g. data frame can check parsed : Querying p-value rsid also possible slower chrompos indexed. Mac Linux, rsid p-value queries performed calls bcftools. Windows uses VariantAnnotation directly, bcftools binaries available. unfortunately somewhat slower. many operations performed might faster read whole dataset perform queries way.
code: cp <- c("1:10000", "2:10000-20000") cp <- dplyr::tibble(chrom=c(1,2), start=c(10000,10000), end=c(10000, 20000)) parse_chrompos(cp) #> GRanges object with 2 ranges and 0 metadata columns: #>       seqnames      ranges strand #>          <Rle>   <IRanges>  <Rle> #>   [1]        1       10000      * #>   [2]        2 10000-20000      * #>   ------- #>   seqinfo: 2 sequences from an unspecified genome; no seqlengths

title: Reading, querying and writing GWAS summary data in VCF format
text: set rsids requested vcf absent, reference panel can used search LD proxies, extract , align effects alleles original variants requested. two ways perform LD proxy search: using set genotyped samples LD reference panel (e.g. 1000 genomes data) - slow relatively convenient compiling LD tag list LD reference panel - generated fast

title: Reading, querying and writing GWAS summary data in VCF format
text: LD reference panel can obtained : http://fileserve.mrcieu.ac.uk/ld/data_maf0.01_rs_ref.tgz. dataset comprises Europeans 1000 genomes project, plink format, including SNPs MAF > 0.01, reference alleles aligned human genome reference sequence. vignette can use small subset dataset: also need provide path plink binary used generate LD calculations. can done genetics.binaRies package bcftools rs4442317 variant present vcf file, .e. query variant: see proxy variant rs4970420. may also extract best available proxies even requested rsids present, using proxies="". example shows effect size estimates proxy variants aligned effect alleles target variants: Plot target data effects proxy data effects
code: ldfile <- system.file("extdata", "eur.bed", package="gwasvcf") %>%    gsub(".bed", "", .) set_plink() #> Path not provided, using binaries in the MRCIEU/genetics.binaRies package query_gwas(vcffile, rsid="rs4442317") %>% nrow #> [1] 0 vcf <- query_gwas(vcffile, rsid="rs4442317", proxies="yes", bfile=ldfile, tag_r2=0.05) #> Initial search... #> Extracted 0 out of 1 rsids #> Searching for proxies for 1 rsids #> Determining searchspace... #> Proxy lookup... #> Finding proxies... #> Found 10 proxies #> Extrating proxies... #> Identified proxies for 1 of 1 rsids #> Aligning... vcf %>% vcf_to_granges() #> GRanges object with 1 range and 15 metadata columns: #>             seqnames    ranges strand |         REF         ALT      QUAL #>                <Rle> <IRanges>  <Rle> | <character> <character> <numeric> #>   rs4442317        1   1106784      * |           T           C        NA #>                  FILTER        ES        SE        LP        AF        SS        EZ #>             <character> <numeric> <numeric> <numeric> <numeric> <numeric> <numeric> #>   rs4442317        PASS    0.0059    0.0071  0.391474    0.8559    138001        NA #>                    SI        NC          ID          PR          id #>             <numeric> <numeric> <character> <character> <character> #>   rs4442317        NA        NA   rs4970420   rs4970420     IEU-a-2 #>   ------- #>   seqinfo: 1 sequence from an unspecified genome; no seqlengths # Read vcf a <- readVcf(vcffile)  # Obtain the best LD proxy for each of the rsids b <- query_gwas(vcffile, rsid=names(a), proxies="only", bfile=ldfile, tag_r2=0.6) #> Determining searchspace... #> Proxy lookup... #> Finding proxies... #> Found 270 proxies #> Extrating proxies... #> Identified proxies for 52 of 1 rsids #> Aligning...  # Match the target data to the proxy data index <- match(names(b), names(a))  # Plot the target data effects against the proxy data effects plot(vcf_to_granges(b)$ES, vcf_to_granges(a)$ES[index])

what: Compiling a list of tagging variants
title: Reading, querying and writing GWAS summary data in VCF format
text: Using LD reference panel described , possible create sqlite tag reference panel using following commands. First get example LD reference panel: also need provide path plink binary used generate LD calculations. can done genetics.binaRies package bcftools Now generate tagging database Perform query
code: ldfile <- system.file("extdata", "eur.bed", package="gwasvcf") %>%    gsub(".bed", "", .) set_plink() #> Path not provided, using binaries in the MRCIEU/genetics.binaRies package dbfile <- tempfile() create_ldref_sqlite(ldfile, dbfile, tag_r2 = 0.05) #> identifying indels to remove #> calculating ld tags #> formatting #> creating sqlite db vcf <- query_gwas(vcffile, rsid="rs4442317", proxies="yes", dbfile=dbfile, tag_r2=0.05) #> Initial search... #> Extracted 0 out of 1 rsids #> Searching for proxies for 1 rsids #> Proxy lookup... #> Found 168 proxies #> Extrating proxies... #> Identified proxies for 1 of 1 rsids #> Aligning... vcf %>% vcf_to_granges() #> GRanges object with 1 range and 15 metadata columns: #>             seqnames    ranges strand |         REF         ALT      QUAL #>                <Rle> <IRanges>  <Rle> | <character> <character> <numeric> #>   rs4442317        1   1106784      * |           T           C        NA #>                  FILTER        ES        SE        LP        AF        SS        EZ #>             <character> <numeric> <numeric> <numeric> <numeric> <numeric> <numeric> #>   rs4442317        PASS    -4e-04    0.0066 0.0214999       0.9    233073        NA #>                    SI        NC          ID          PR          id #>             <numeric> <numeric> <character> <character> <character> #>   rs4442317        NA        NA  rs10907175  rs10907175     IEU-a-2 #>   ------- #>   seqinfo: 1 sequence from an unspecified genome; no seqlengths

what: Creating the VCF object from a data frame
title: Reading, querying and writing GWAS summary data in VCF format
text: GWAS summary data text file data frame, can converted VCF object. ’s possible write vcf file: may want first harmonise data non-effect alleles aligned human genome reference. See gwasglue package functions .
code: vcf <- readVcf(vcffile) vv <- vcf_to_granges(vcf) %>% dplyr::as_tibble() out <- vv %$% create_vcf(chrom=seqnames, pos=start, nea=REF, ea=ALT, snp=ID, ea_af=AF, effect=ES, se=SE, pval=10^-LP, n=SS, name="a") out #> class: CollapsedVCF  #> dim: 92 1  #> rowRanges(vcf): #>   GRanges with 4 metadata columns: REF, ALT, QUAL, FILTER #> info(vcf): #>   DataFrame with 0 columns:  #> geno(vcf): #>   List of length 6: AF, ES, SE, LP, SS, ID #> geno(header(vcf)): #>       Number Type   Description                                             #>    AF A      Float  Alternate allele frequency in the association study     #>    ES A      Float  Effect size estimate relative to the alternative allele #>    SE A      Float  Standard error of effect size estimate                  #>    LP A      Float  -log10 p-value for effect estimate                      #>    SS A      Float  Sample size used to estimate genetic effect             #>    ID A      String Study variant identifier writeVcf(out, file="temp.vcf")

what: Creating a gwasglue2 SummarySet object from a vcf file
title: Reading, querying and writing GWAS summary data in VCF format
text: Although still development, compared predecessor, gwasglue2 package several new features, including use S4 R objects. possible create SummarySet object GWAS-VCF file VCF object e.g. output VariantAnnotation::readVcf(), create_vcf() query_gwas() using gwasvcf_to_summaryset() function. example: SummarySet objects created, possible use gwasglue2 harmonise data, harmonise LD matrix, remap genomic coordinates different genome assembly, convert formats .

what: Tools for Dealing with GWAS Summary Data in VCF Format
title: Tools for Dealing with GWAS Summary Data in VCF Format
text: Complete GWAS summary datasets now abundant. large repository curated, harmonised QC’d datasets available IEU GWAS database. can queried via API directly, ieugwasr R package, ieugwaspy Python package. However, faster querying can used HPC environment, accessing data directly cloud systems advantageous. developed format storing harmonising GWAS summary data known GWAS VCF format can created using gwas2vcf. data IEU GWAS database available download format. R package provides fast convenient functions querying creating GWAS summary data GWAS VCF format (v1.0). See also pygwasvcf Python3 parser querying GWAS VCF files. package includes: wrapper around bioconductor/VariantAnnotation package, providing functions tailored GWAS VCF reading, querying, creating writing GWAS VCF format files LD related functions using reference panel extract proxies, create LD matrices perform LD clumping functions harmonising dataset reference genome creating GWAS VCF files. See also gwasglue R package methods connect VCF data Mendelian randomization, colocalisation, fine mapping etc.

text: Read GWAS summary data filters datasets (multiple datasets per file) /chromosome/position, rsids pvalues. Chooses optimal choice detected operating system. Typically chrompos searches fastest. Windows, rsid pvalue filters file slow.

title: Query data from vcf file — query_gwas
code: query_gwas(   vcf,   chrompos = NULL,   rsid = NULL,   pval = NULL,   id = NULL,   rsidx = NULL,   pvali = NULL,   build = "GRCh37",   os = Sys.info()[["sysname"]],   proxies = "no",   bfile = NULL,   dbfile = NULL,   tag_kb = 5000,   tag_nsnp = 5000,   tag_r2 = 0.6,   threads = 1 )

title: Query data from vcf file — query_gwas
text: vcf Path URL GWAS-VCF file VCF object e.g. output VariantAnnotation::readVcf() create_vcf() chrompos Either vector chromosome position ranges e.g. "1:1000" "1:1000-2000", data frame columns chrom, start, end. rsid Vector rsids pval P-value threshold (-log10) id multiple GWAS datasets vcf file, name (sample ID) perform filter rsidx Path rsidx index file pvali Path pval index file build ="GRCh37" Build vcffile os operating system. Default detected. Determines method used perform query proxies ="" SNPs absent look proxies (yes) (). Can also mask target SNPs return proxies (), testing purposes. Currently possible querying rsid. bfile =path plink bed/bim/fam ld reference panel dbfile =path sqlite tag snp database tag_kb =5000 Proxy parameter tag_nsnp =5000 Proxy parameter tag_r2 =0.6 Proxy parameter threads =1 NUmber threads
